content.user_title: Capture requirements and explore solution options
content.value_statement: Teams often start building before understanding the true problem. This skill transforms vague ideas into clear requirements through structured conversation. It captures original intent, explores multiple approaches, and documents decisions for traceability throughout the development lifecycle.
actual_capabilities: Guide one-question-at-a-time conversations to understand user needs
Explore 2-3 alternative approaches with trade-offs analysis
Present design in incremental segments for validation
Generate BRAINSTORM.md documentation with original intent, constraints, and decisions
Verify alignment between subsequent phases and original requirements
Prevent scope creep by documenting decision rationale
limitations: Only triggers during /flow-init phase, not a standalone tool
Does not generate code, tests, or implementation details
Requires user engagement for requirement clarification
Output quality depends on user input clarity and cooperation

use_cases.title: Transform vague ideas into specs
use_cases.description: Convert abstract product visions into structured requirements with clear success criteria

use_cases.title: Explore solution alternatives
use_cases.description: Evaluate multiple technical approaches with trade-offs before committing to a design

use_cases.title: Create requirement documentation
use_cases.description: Generate BRAINSTORM.md files that serve as reference points throughout the project

prompt_templates.title: New feature request
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me define requirements for a new feature. What problem does it solve and what are the core requirements?

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring decision
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to refactor the authentication module. What approaches should I consider and what are their trade-offs?

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: We have a performance issue reported by users. Help me explore possible causes and solutions.

prompt_templates.title: Design validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my proposed solution and check if it aligns with the original requirements I documented.

best_practices: Ask one question at a time with multiple-choice options for faster responses
Always explore 2-3 alternatives before committing to a solution approach
Document decision rationale to prevent future scope creep debates
anti_patterns: Skipping brainstorming and jumping directly to implementation
Assuming requirements are clear without asking clarifying questions
Making technical decisions without recording the trade-offs considered

faq.question: What tools is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code CLI environments.

faq.question: What happens if I skip the brainstorming phase?
faq.answer: The skill enforces brainstorming as an entry gate. Subsequent flow phases require BRAINSTORM.md alignment verification.

faq.question: Can I use this outside the /flow-init phase?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for the /flow-init phase but its questioning technique applies to any requirements gathering session.

faq.question: Is my data safe when generating BRAINSTORM.md?
faq.answer: The skill only writes documentation files locally. No data is sent to external servers or third-party services.

faq.question: How does this compare to other planning tools?
faq.answer: Unlike generic planners, this skill enforces YAGNI principles and requires documenting decision rationale for traceability.

faq.question: What if requirements change during development?
faq.answer: The skill includes alignment checks in later phases to detect drift from original intent and prompts documentation updates.
